name: Hydrogen
summary: Hydrogen is the lightest and most abundant element in the universe. It is a colorless, odorless, tasteless, non-toxic, nonmetallic, highly combustible diatomic gas.

name: Helium
discovery: 1868 by Pierre Janssen and Norman Lockyer
summary: Helium is a colorless, odorless, tasteless, non-toxic, inert, monatomic gas. It is the second lightest and second most abundant element in the observable universe.

name: Lithium
summary: Lithium is a soft, silvery-white alkali metal. Under standard conditions, it is the lightest metal and the lightest solid element.

name: Beryllium
summary: Beryllium is a steel-gray, strong, lightweight and brittle alkaline earth metal.

name: Boron
discovery: 1808 by Joseph Louis Gay-Lussac and Louis Jacques Thénard
summary: Boron is a metalloid chemical element. It has several forms, the most common of which is amorphous boron, a dark powder.

name: Carbon
summary: Carbon is a nonmetallic element with atomic number 6. It is the basis of all known life and forms more compounds than any other element.

name: Nitrogen
summary: Nitrogen is a colorless, odorless, tasteless diatomic gas that constitutes 78% of Earth's atmosphere.

name: Oxygen
discovery: 1774 by Joseph Priestley and Carl Wilhelm Scheele
summary: Oxygen is a highly reactive nonmetal and oxidizing agent that readily forms oxides with most elements.

name: Fluorine
summary: Fluorine is the lightest halogen and exists as a highly toxic pale yellow diatomic gas at standard conditions.

name: Neon
discovery: 1898 by William Ramsay and Morris Travers
summary: Neon is a colorless, odorless, inert monatomic gas under standard conditions.

name: Sodium
summary: Sodium is a soft, silvery-white, highly reactive metal.

name: Magnesium
summary: Magnesium is a shiny gray solid which bears a close physical resemblance to the other five elements in the second column of the periodic table.

name: Aluminum
summary: Aluminum is a silvery-white, soft, nonmagnetic, ductile metal in the boron group.

name: Silicon
summary: Silicon is a hard and brittle crystalline solid with a blue-grey metallic lustre.

name: Phosphorus
summary: Phosphorus is a reactive nonmetal that exists in several allotropic forms.

name: Sulfur
summary: Sulfur is an abundant, multivalent non-metal. Under normal conditions, sulfur atoms form cyclic octatomic molecules.

name: Chlorine
summary: Chlorine is a yellow-green gas at room temperature. It is an extremely reactive element and a strong oxidizing agent.

name: Argon
discovery: 1894 by Lord Rayleigh and William Ramsay
summary: Argon is a colorless, odorless, nonflammable and nontoxic gas.

name: Potassium
summary: Potassium is a soft silvery-white metal that reacts violently with water.

name: Calcium
summary: Calcium is a soft gray alkaline earth metal, fifth-most-abundant element by mass in the Earth's crust.

name: Scandium
summary: Scandium is a silvery-white metallic element.

name: Titanium
summary: Titanium is a lustrous transition metal with a silver color, low density, and high strength.

name: Vanadium
summary: Vanadium is a hard, silvery-grey, ductile, and malleable transition metal.

name: Chromium
summary: Chromium is a steely-grey, lustrous, hard and brittle transition metal.

name: Manganese
summary: Manganese is a silvery-gray metal that resembles iron.

name: Iron
summary: Iron is a metal in the first transition series. It is the most common element on Earth by mass.

name: Cobalt
summary: Cobalt is a hard, lustrous, silver-gray metal.

name: Nickel
summary: Nickel is a silvery-white lustrous metal with a slight golden tinge.

name: Copper
summary: Copper is a soft, malleable, and ductile metal with very high thermal and electrical conductivity.

name: Zinc
summary: Zinc is a slightly brittle metal at room temperature with a blue-silvery appearance.

name: Gallium
summary: Gallium is a soft silvery metal used primarily in electronic circuits, semiconductors and light-emitting diodes.

name: Germanium
summary: Germanium is a lustrous, hard, grayish-white metalloid in the carbon group.

name: Arsenic
summary: Arsenic is a metalloid and one of the pnictogens. It has various allotropes, but only the gray form is important to industry.

name: Selenium
summary: Selenium is a nonmetal with properties that are intermediate between the elements above and below in the periodic table.

name: Bromine
summary: Bromine is a chemical element with a fuming red-brown liquid at room temperature that evaporates readily.

name: Krypton
discovery: 1898 by William Ramsay and Morris Travers
summary: Krypton is a colorless, odorless, tasteless noble gas that occurs in trace amounts in the atmosphere.

name: Rubidium
discovery: 1861 by Robert Bunsen and Gustav Kirchhoff
summary: Rubidium is a soft, silvery-white metallic element of the alkali metal group.

name: Strontium
summary: Strontium is a soft silver-white yellowish metallic element that is highly reactive chemically.

name: Yttrium
summary: Yttrium is a silvery-metallic transition metal chemically similar to the lanthanides.

name: Zirconium
summary: Zirconium is a lustrous, grey-white, strong transition metal that resembles hafnium.

name: Niobium
summary: Niobium is a soft, grey, ductile transition metal.

name: Molybdenum
summary: Molybdenum is a silvery metal with a gray cast, has the sixth-highest melting point of any element.

name: Technetium
discovery: 1937 by Carlo Perrier and Emilio Segrè
summary: Technetium is a silvery-gray radioactive metal. It is the lightest element whose isotopes are all radioactive.

name: Ruthenium
summary: Ruthenium is a rare transition metal belonging to the platinum group of the periodic table.

name: Rhodium
summary: Rhodium is a rare, silvery-white, hard, and chemically inert transition metal.

name: Palladium
summary: Palladium is a rare and lustrous silvery-white metal discovered in 1803.

name: Silver
summary: Silver is a soft, white, lustrous transition metal, it exhibits the highest electrical conductivity of any element.

name: Cadmium
discovery: 1817 by Karl Samuel Leberecht Hermann and Friedrich Stromeyer
summary: Cadmium is a soft, bluish-white metal chemically similar to zinc and mercury.

name: Indium
discovery: 1863 by Ferdinand Reich and Hieronymous Theodor Richter
summary: Indium is a post-transition metal that makes up 0.21 parts per million of the Earth's crust.

name: Tin
summary: Tin is a post-transition metal in group 14 of the periodic table.

name: Antimony
summary: Antimony is a lustrous gray metalloid found in nature mainly as the sulfide mineral stibnite.

name: Tellurium
summary: Tellurium is a brittle, mildly toxic, rare, silver-white metalloid.

name: Iodine
summary: Iodine is a chemical element with the symbol I and atomic number 53.

name: Xenon
discovery: 1898 by William Ramsay and Morris Travers
summary: Xenon is a colorless, dense, odorless noble gas found in the Earth's atmosphere in trace amounts.

name: Cesium
discovery: 1860 by Robert Bunsen and Gustav Kirchhoff
summary: Cesium is a soft, silvery-gold alkali metal with a melting point of 28.5 °C.

name: Barium
summary: Barium is a soft, silvery alkaline earth metal.

name: Lanthanum
summary: Lanthanum is a soft, ductile, silvery-white metal that tarnishes rapidly when exposed to air.

name: Cerium
summary: Cerium is a soft, ductile and silvery-white metal that tarnishes when exposed to air.

name: Praseodymium
summary: Praseodymium is a soft, silvery, malleable and ductile metal in the lanthanide group.

name: Neodymium
summary: Neodymium is a soft silvery metal that tarnishes in air.

name: Promethium
summary: Promethium is a radioactive rare earth element.

name: Samarium
summary: Samarium is a moderately hard silvery metal that readily oxidizes in air.

name: Europium
summary: Europium is the most reactive lanthanide by far, having to be stored under an inert fluid to protect it from atmospheric oxygen or moisture.

name: Gadolinium
discovery: 1880 by Jean Charles Galissard de Marignac
summary: Gadolinium is a silvery-white, malleable, and ductile rare earth metal.

name: Terbium
summary: Terbium is a silvery-white rare earth metal that is malleable, ductile and soft enough to be cut with a knife.

name: Dysprosium
summary: Dysprosium is a rare earth element with a metallic silver luster.

name: Holmium
discovery: 1878 by Marc Delafontaine and Jacques-Louis Soret
summary: Holmium is a relatively soft and malleable silvery-white metal.

name: Erbium
summary: Erbium is a silvery-white solid metal when artificially isolated, natural erbium is always found in chemical combination with other elements.

name: Thulium
summary: Thulium is the thirteenth and antepenultimate element in the lanthanide series.

name: Ytterbium
discovery: 1878 by Jean Charles Galissard de Marignac
summary: Ytterbium is a soft, malleable and ductile chemical element that displays a bright silvery luster when pure.

name: Lutetium
discovery: 1907 by Georges Urbain and Carl Auer von Welsbach
summary: Lutetium is a silvery white metal, which resists corrosion in dry, but not in moist air.

name: Hafnium
discovery: 1923 by Dirk Coster and George de Hevesy
summary: Hafnium is a lustrous, silvery gray, tetravalent transition metal.

name: Tantalum
summary: Tantalum is a rare, hard, blue-gray, lustrous transition metal that is highly corrosion-resistant.

name: Tungsten
discovery: 1783 by Juan José Elhuyar and Fausto Elhuyar
summary: Tungsten is a rare metal found naturally on Earth almost exclusively in chemical compounds.

name: Rhenium
discovery: 1925 by Walter Noddack, Ida Tacke, and Otto Berg
summary: Rhenium is a silvery-white, heavy, third-row transition metal in group 7 of the periodic table.

name: Osmium
summary: Osmium is a hard, brittle, bluish-white transition metal in the platinum group.

name: Iridium
summary: Iridium is a very hard, brittle, silvery-white transition metal of the platinum group.

name: Platinum
summary: Platinum is a dense, malleable, ductile, highly unreactive, precious, silverish-white transition metal.

name: Gold
summary: Gold is a dense, soft, shiny metal and the most malleable and ductile metal known.

name: Mercury
summary: Mercury is a heavy, silvery-white liquid metal. It is the only metallic element that is liquid at standard conditions.

name: Thallium
summary: Thallium is a soft gray post-transition metal that is not found free in nature.

name: Lead
summary: Lead is a heavy metal that is denser than most common materials.

name: Bismuth
summary: Bismuth is a brittle metal with a white, silver-pink hue, often with an iridescent oxide tarnish.

name: Polonium
discovery: 1898 by Marie Curie and Pierre Curie
summary: Polonium is a rare and highly radioactive metal with no stable isotopes.

name: Astatine
discovery: 1940 by Dale R. Corson, Kenneth Ross MacKenzie, and Emilio Segrè
summary: Astatine is a very rare radioactive chemical element.

name: Radon
summary: Radon is a radioactive, colorless, odorless, tasteless noble gas.

name: Francium
summary: Francium is a highly radioactive metal that decays into astatine, radium, and radon.

name: Radium
discovery: 1898 by Marie Curie and Pierre Curie
summary: Radium is a highly radioactive element and is the heaviest of the alkaline earth metals.

name: Actinium
summary: Actinium is a radioactive element and is the eponym of the actinide series.

name: Thorium
summary: Thorium is a weakly radioactive metallic chemical element.

name: Protactinium
discovery: 1913 by Kasimir Fajans and Oswald Helmuth Göhring
summary: Protactinium is a dense, silvery-gray actinide metal which readily reacts with oxygen, water vapor and inorganic acids.

name: Uranium
summary: Uranium is a silvery-white metallic chemical element in the actinide series of the periodic table.

name: Neptunium
discovery: 1940 by Edwin McMillan and Philip H. Abelson
summary: Neptunium is a radioactive actinide element. It is the first transuranic element.

name: Plutonium
summary: Plutonium is a transuranic radioactive chemical element.

name: Americium
summary: Americium is a transuranic member of the actinide series, in the periodic table located under the lanthanide element europium.

name: Curium
summary: Curium is a transuranic radioactive chemical element, named after Marie and Pierre Curie.

name: Berkelium
summary: Berkelium is a transuranic radioactive chemical element and a member of the actinide and transuranium element series.

name: Californium
summary: Californium is a radioactive metallic chemical element. The element was first made in 1950 at the University of California Radiation Laboratory in Berkeley.

name: Einsteinium
summary: Einsteinium is a synthetic element. It is the seventh transuranic element.

name: Fermium
summary: Fermium is a synthetic element. It is the heaviest element that can be formed by neutron bombardment of lighter elements.

name: Mendelevium
summary: Mendelevium is a synthetic element. It was the first element to be synthesized one atom at a time.

name: Nobelium
summary: Nobelium is a synthetic chemical element. It is a radioactive metal.

name: Lawrencium
summary: Lawrencium is a synthetic chemical element. It is the eleventh transuranic element and is also the final member of the actinide series.

name: Rutherfordium
summary: Rutherfordium is a synthetic element. It is a radioactive transactinide element.

name: Dubnium
summary: Dubnium is a synthetic chemical element. It is a highly radioactive metal.

name: Seaborgium
summary: Seaborgium is a synthetic element. It is a radioactive metal.

name: Bohrium
discovery: 1981 by Peter Armbruster and Gottfried Münzenberg
summary: Bohrium is a synthetic chemical element. It is a radioactive metal.

name: Hassium
discovery: 1984 by Peter Armbruster and Gottfried Münzenberg
summary: Hassium is a synthetic element. It is a radioactive metal.

name: Meitnerium
discovery: 1982 by Peter Armbruster and Gottfried Münzenberg
summary: Meitnerium is a synthetic element. It is a radioactive metal.

name: Darmstadtium
summary: Darmstadtium is a synthetic element. It is a radioactive metal.

name: Roentgenium
summary: Roentgenium is a synthetic element. It is a radioactive metal.

name: Copernicium
summary: Copernicium is a synthetic element. It is a radioactive metal.

name: Nihonium
summary: Nihonium is a synthetic element. It is a radioactive metal.

name: Flerovium
discovery: 1999 by Joint Institute for Nuclear Research
summary: Flerovium is a superheavy artificial chemical element.

name: Moscovium
discovery: 2003 by Joint Institute for Nuclear Research
summary: Moscovium is a synthetic element. It is a radioactive metal.

name: Livermorium
discovery: 2000 by Joint Institute for Nuclear Research
summary: Livermorium is a synthetic element. It is a radioactive metal.

name: Tennessine
discovery: 2010 by Joint Institute for Nuclear Research
summary: Tennessine is a synthetic element. It is a radioactive metal.

name: Oganesson
discovery: 2002 by Joint Institute for Nuclear Research
summary: Oganesson is a synthetic element. It is a radioactive noble gas.
